custom_item_1.description: 1.1.1.1.2 Ensure passcode is set to have at least 1 letter
custom_item_1.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your passcode must meet. As per passcode requirements, have at least 1 letter (a, b, c...). This shall make the passcode strong.

Rationale:
custom_item_1.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Passcode Requirement -> Have at least 1 letter (a, b, c...), and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_2.description: 1.1.1.1.3 Ensure passcode is set to have at least 1 number
custom_item_2.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your passcode must meet. As per passcode requirements, Have at least 1 number (1, 2, 3...). This shall make the passcode strong.

Rationale:
custom_item_2.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Passcode Requirement -> Have at least 1 number (1, 2, 3...), and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_3.description: 1.1.1.1.4 Ensure passcode is set to have at least 1 special character
custom_item_3.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your passcode must meet. As per passcode requirements, Have at least 1 special character (!, @, #...). This shall make the passcode strong.

Rationale:

This ensures the passcode complexity requirements are met and a strong passcode is set for meetings.
custom_item_3.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Passcode Requirement -> Have at least 1 special character (!, @, #...), and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_4.description: 1.1.1.1.5 Ensure passcode include both uppercase and lowercase characters is set to enabled
custom_item_4.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your passcode must meet. As per passcode requirements, Include both uppercase and lowercase characters. This shall make the passcode strong.

Rationale:

This ensures the passcode complexity requirements are met and a strong passcode is set for meetings.
custom_item_4.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Passcode Requirement -> Include both uppercase and lowercase characters, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_5.description: 1.1.1.1.6 Ensure passcode cannot contain consecutive characters is set to enabled
custom_item_5.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your passcode must meet. Cannot contain consecutive characters (e.g. '11111', '12345', 'abcde', or 'qwert').

Rationale:

This ensures the passcode complexity requirements are met and a strong passcode is set for meetings.
custom_item_5.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Passcode Requirement -> Cannot contain consecutive characters (e.g. '11111', '12345', 'abcde', or 'qwert'), and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_6.description: 1.1.1.1.7 Ensure enhanced weak passcode detection is set to enabled
custom_item_6.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your passcode can meet. As per passcode requirements, Use enhanced weak passcode detection. This shall make the passcode strong.

Rationale:

This ensures the passcode complexity requirements are met and a strong passcode is set for meetings.
custom_item_6.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Passcode Requirement -> Use enhanced weak passcode detection, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_7.description: 1.1.1.1.8 Ensure only allow numeric passcode is set to disabled
custom_item_7.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your passcode must meet. As per passcode requirements, Disable 'Only allow numeric passcode', enabling this shall make the passcode weaker.

Rationale:

This ensures the passcode complexity requirements are met and a strong passcode is set for meetings.
custom_item_7.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Passcode Requirement -> Only allow numeric passcode, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_8.description: 1.1.1.2 Ensure waiting room is set to enabled
custom_item_8.info:
When participants join a meeting, place them in a waiting room and require the host to admit them individually. Enabling the waiting room automatically disables the setting for allowing participants to join before host.

Rationale:

This option ensures that the participants are by default entered into meeting.

Impact:

When hundreds of participants are joining, the Co-Hosts has to admit all participants and may take time.
custom_item_8.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Waiting Room and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_9.description: 1.1.1.4 Ensure require a passcode when scheduling new meetings is set to enabled
custom_item_9.info:
Require a passcode when scheduling new meetings must be set to enabled. A passcode will be generated when scheduling a meeting and participants require the passcode to join the meeting.

Rationale:

Upon scheduling a meeting, a passcode will be generated, this ensures that participants require the passcode to join the meeting.
custom_item_9.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Security -> Require a passcode when scheduling new meetings and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_10.description: 1.1.1.9 Ensure only authenticated users can join meetings is set to enabled
custom_item_10.info:
Rationale:

The participants need to authenticate prior to joining the meetings, hosts can choose one of the authentication methods when scheduling a meeting.
custom_item_10.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Security -> Only authenticated users can join meetings and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_11.info:
For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your password must meet. These apply when setting your initial password and when resetting your password. As per password requirements, include at least 1 special character (!, @, #...).

Rationale:

custom_item_12.description: 1.1.2.6 Ensure use personal meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting is set to disabled
custom_item_12.info:
Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting should be set to disabled.

Rationale:

This ensures a new meeting ID is used for new scheduled meetings. If there are nuisance users, they cannot be use an old meeting ID to join a meeting.
custom_item_12.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Scheduled Meeting -> Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting, and ensure it is set to disabled.

custom_item_13.description: 1.1.2.7 Ensure use personal meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting is set to disabled
custom_item_13.info:
Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting should be set to disabled.

Rationale:

Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting set to disabled ensures that someone who knows a personal meeting ID from a previous meeting cannot join a meeting without a proper invitation and knowing the code.
custom_item_13.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Scheduled Meeting -> Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting, and ensure it is set to disabled.

custom_item_14.description: 1.1.2.8 Ensure add watermark is set to enabled
custom_item_14.info:
Adding watermark enables author accreditation. Each attendee sees a portion of their own email address embedded as a watermark in any shared content and on the video of the participant who is sharing their screen. This option requires enabling 'Only signed-in users can join the meeting' or 'Only signed-in users with specified domains can join meetings'.

Rationale:
custom_item_14.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Scheduled Meeting -> Add watermark, and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_15.description: 1.1.2.9 Ensure add audio watermark is set to enabled
custom_item_15.info:
Adding audio watermark, enables invisible accreditation. If an attendee records the meeting, their personal information will be embedded in the audio as an inaudible watermark. This option requires enabling 'Only signed-in users can join the meeting' or 'Only signed-in users with specified domains can join meetings'.

Rationale:
custom_item_15.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Scheduled Meeting -> Add audio watermark, and check if it is set to enabled.

custom_item_16.description: 1.1.2.10 Ensure always display 'Zoom Meeting' as the meeting topic is set to enabled
custom_item_16.info:
Hide actual meeting topic and display 'Zoom Meeting' for your scheduled meetings. Helps confidentiality of meeting topic public display.

Rationale:
custom_item_16.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Schedule Meeting -> Always display 'Zoom Meeting' as the meeting topic, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_17.description: 1.1.2.13 Ensure upcoming meeting reminder is set to enabled
custom_item_17.info:
Enable this option to receive desktop notification for upcoming meetings. Reminder time can be configured in the Zoom Desktop Client.

Rationale:
custom_item_17.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Settings -> Meeting -> Schedule Meeting -> Upcoming meeting reminder and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_18.description: 1.1.3.1.1 Ensure allow meeting participants to send a message visible to all participants is set to disabled
custom_item_18.info:
Allow meeting participants to send a message visible to all participants. This can be further controlled from client end by the host / co-host.

Rationale:
custom_item_18.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Allow meeting participants to send a message visible to all participants, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_19.description: 1.1.3.1.2 Ensure prevent participants from saving chat is set to enabled
custom_item_19.info:
Prevent participants from saving chat, ensures that participants do not copy what is pasted in the zoom meeting chat.

Rationale:

Impact:

Disables the ability of participants from copying content from chat, which may have been purposefully shared by the host to participants.
custom_item_19.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Prevent participants from saving chat, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_20.description: 1.1.3.2.1 Ensure sound notification when someone joins or leaves is set to enabled
custom_item_20.info:
Enable 'Play sound when participants join or leave'. This can also be controlled from host client end if required to be changed.

Rationale:

This option enables Host and co-hosts to know that participants are joining/leaving.
custom_item_20.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Sound notification when someone joins or leaves, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_21.description: 1.1.3.2.2 Ensure play sound for 'Host and co-host only' is set to enabled
custom_item_21.info:
Change from 'Everyone' option under [Play sound for] to 'Host and co-hosts only'.

Rationale:

This option enables Host and co-hosts to know that participants are joining/leaving.
custom_item_21.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Sound notification when someone joins or leaves -> Play sound for -> Host and co-hosts only, and check ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_22.description: 1.1.3.2.3 Ensure when someone joins by phone, ask to record their voice to use as the notification is set to enabled
custom_item_22.info:
Select 'Ask to record their voice to use as the notification' option for 'When someone joins by phone'.

Rationale:

This option enables Host and co-hosts to know that participants are joining/leaving while joining from phone.
custom_item_22.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Sound notification when someone joins or leaves -> When someone joins by phone -> Ask to record their voice to use as the notification, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_23.description: 1.1.3.3.1 Ensure hosts and participants can send files through the in-meeting chat is set to disabled
custom_item_23.info:
Hosts and participants can send files through the in-meeting chat. As this is account level setting keep this enabled. If option of file transfer is required, then use it along with allowing specific file extension.

Rationale:
custom_item_23.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Hosts and participants can send files through the in-meeting chat., and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_24.description: 1.1.3.4.1 Ensure screen sharing is set to enabled
custom_item_24.info:
Allow host and participants to share their screen or content during meetings. Enable this option to ensure further options are customizable to control who can share screen or desktop audio.

Rationale:
custom_item_24.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Screen sharing, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_25.description: 1.1.3.4.2 Ensure 'who can share?' is set to 'Host Only'
custom_item_25.info:
Select 'Who can share?' as 'Host Only' here. This can be controlled by host for a particular meeting at desktop client software.

Rationale:
custom_item_25.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Who can share?, and ensure 'Host Only' is enabled.

custom_item_26.description: 1.1.3.4.3 Ensure 'Who can start sharing when someone else is sharing?' is set to 'Host Only'
custom_item_26.info:
This setting decides who can share screen when someone is already sharing. This option should be restricted to 'Host Only'. This can be changed or controlled by host for a particular meeting instance.

Rationale:
custom_item_26.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Who can start sharing when someone else is sharing? and ensure 'Host Only' is enabled.

custom_item_27.description: 1.1.3.5.1 Ensure annotation is set to disabled
custom_item_27.info:
Allow host and participants to use annotation tools to add information to shared screens.

Rationale:
custom_item_27.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Annotation and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_28.description: 1.1.3.5.2 Ensure allow saving of shared screens with annotations is set to disabled
custom_item_28.info:
Disable 'Allow saving of shared screens with annotations'

Rationale:
custom_item_28.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Allow saving of shared screens with annotations and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_29.description: 1.1.3.6.1 Ensure whiteboard is set to disabled
custom_item_29.info:
Allow host and participants to share whiteboard during a meeting.

Rationale:
custom_item_29.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Whiteboard and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_30.description: 1.1.3.6.2 Ensure allow saving of whiteboard content is set to disabled
custom_item_30.info:
Allow host and participants to share whiteboard during a meeting. And also allow saving of whiteboard content. This can be controlled at meeting level.

Rationale:
custom_item_30.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Allow saving of whiteboard content and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_31.description: 1.1.3.6.3 Ensure auto save whiteboard content when sharing is stopped is set to disabled
custom_item_31.info:
Allow host and participants to share whiteboard during a meeting. And disallow Auto save whiteboard content when sharing is stopped. This can be controlled at meeting level.

Rationale:
custom_item_31.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Auto save whiteboard content when sharing is stopped and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_32.description: 1.1.3.10 Ensure feedback to Zoom is set to enabled
custom_item_32.info:
Add a Feedback tab to the Windows Settings or Mac Preferences dialog, and also enable users to provide feedback to Zoom at the end of the meeting.

Rationale:
custom_item_32.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Feedback to Zoom, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_33.description: 1.1.3.11 Ensure co-host is set to enabled
custom_item_33.info:
Allow the host to add co-hosts. Co-hosts have the same in-meeting controls as the host.

Rationale:
custom_item_33.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Co-host, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_34.description: 1.1.3.12 Ensure polling is set to enabled
custom_item_34.info:
Add 'Polls' to the meeting controls. This allows the host to survey the attendees. Polls also enables the host to validate if participants are active.

Rationale:
custom_item_34.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Polling, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_35.description: 1.1.3.13 Ensure always show meeting control toolbar is set to enabled
custom_item_35.info:
Always show meeting controls during a meeting. This helps in responding to situations where host / co-host need to quickly navigate controls to handle a situation.

Rationale:
custom_item_35.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Always show meeting control toolbar, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_36.description: 1.1.3.14 Ensure show Zoom windows during screen share is set to enabled
custom_item_36.info:
Show Zoom windows during screen share. This shall help in quickly controlling a situation where someone needs to be muted/removed from the meeting.

Rationale:
custom_item_36.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Show Zoom windows during screen share, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_37.description: 1.1.3.16 Ensure remote control is set to disabled
custom_item_37.info:
During screen sharing, the person who is sharing can allow others to control the shared content.

Rationale:
custom_item_37.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Remote control, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_38.description: 1.1.3.17 Ensure nonverbal feedback is set to disabled
custom_item_38.info:
Participants in a meeting can provide nonverbal feedback and express opinions by clicking on icons in the Participants panel. Disabling this avoids participants misusing this feature.

Rationale:
custom_item_38.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Nonverbal feedback, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_39.description: 1.1.3.18 Ensure meeting reactions is set to disabled
custom_item_39.info:
Allow meeting participants to communicate without interrupting by reacting with an emoji that shows on their video. Reactions disappear after 10 seconds. Participants can change their reaction skin tone in Settings. This option can be misused by mischievous participants.

Rationale:
custom_item_39.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Basic) -> Meeting reactions, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_40.description: 1.1.4.1.1 Ensure select data center regions for meetings/webinars hosted by your account is set to enabled
custom_item_40.info:
Include all data center regions to provide the best experience for participants joining from all regions. Opting out of data center regions may limit CRC, Dial-in, Call Me, and Invite by Phone options for participants joining from those regions.

Rationale:
custom_item_40.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Select data center regions for meetings/webinars hosted by your account, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_41.description: 1.1.4.1.2 Ensure data center regions is set to local countries
custom_item_41.info:
Not all data centers are configured. Only the required ones are configured. Choose local or trusted region data centers.

Rationale:

NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_41.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Select data center regions for meetings/webinars hosted by your account, and ensures local countries are selected. E.g. For United States, select United States.

custom_item_42.description: 1.1.4.2.1 Ensure breakout room is set to enabled
custom_item_42.info:
Allow host to split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms. This is beneficial, when participants need to be moved to separate virtual rooms.

Rationale:
custom_item_42.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Breakout room, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_43.description: 1.1.4.2.2 Ensure allow host to assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling is set to enabled
custom_item_43.info:
Allow host to assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling.

Rationale:
custom_item_43.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Allow host to assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_44.description: 1.1.4.3.1 Ensure virtual background is set to enabled
custom_item_44.info:
Customize your background to keep your environment private from others in a meeting. This can be used with or without a green screen.

Rationale:
custom_item_44.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Virtual background, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_45.description: 1.1.4.3.2 Ensure allow use of videos for virtual backgrounds is set to disabled
custom_item_45.info:
Customize your background to keep your environment private from others in a meeting. This can be used with or without a green screen. Allow use of videos for virtual backgrounds.

Rationale:
custom_item_45.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Allow use of videos for virtual backgrounds, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_46.description: 1.1.4.3.3 Ensure allow users to upload custom backgrounds is set to disabled
custom_item_46.info:
Customize your background to keep your environment private from others in a meeting. This can be used with or without a green screen. Allow users to upload custom backgrounds. Disabling this option ensures that participants do not have inappropriate backgrounds.

Rationale:
custom_item_46.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Allow users to upload custom backgrounds, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_47.description: 1.1.4.4.1 Ensure peer to peer connection while only 2 people in a meeting is set to disabled
custom_item_47.info:
Allow users to directly connect to one another in a 2-person meeting.

Rationale:
custom_item_47.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Allow users to directly connect to one another in a 2-person meeting, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_48.description: 1.1.4.4.2 Enable listening ports range is set as appropriate for organization
custom_item_48.info:
Listening ports range, select the appropriate ports as per your company or organization settings.

Rationale:
custom_item_48.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Peer to Peer connection while only 2 people in a meeting -> Listening ports range, and ensure it is enabled, also appropriate ports are selected as per organization.

custom_item_49.description: 1.1.4.6 Ensure remote support is set to disabled
custom_item_49.info:
Allow meeting host to provide 1:1 remote support to another participant. Do not enable these options unless, you really need them.

Rationale:
custom_item_49.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Remote support, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_50.description: 1.1.4.7 Ensure closed captioning is set to disabled
custom_item_50.info:
Allow host to type closed captions or assign a participant/third party device to add closed captions.

Rationale:
custom_item_50.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Closed captioning, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_51.description: 1.1.4.8 Ensure save captions is set to disabled
custom_item_51.info:
Allow participants to save fully closed captions or transcripts.

Rationale:
custom_item_51.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Save Captions, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_52.description: 1.1.4.9 Ensure far end camera control is set to disabled
custom_item_52.info:
Allow another user to take control of your camera during a meeting. Both users (the one requesting control and the one giving control) must have this option turned on.

Rationale:
custom_item_52.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Far end camera control, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_53.description: 1.1.4.10 Ensure identify guest participants in the meeting/webinar is set to enabled
custom_item_53.info:
Participants who belong to your account can see that a guest (someone who does not belong to your account) is participating in the meeting/webinar. The Participants list indicates which attendees are guests. The guests themselves do not see that they are listed as guests.

Rationale:
custom_item_53.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Identify guest participants in the meeting/webinar, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_54.description: 1.1.4.11 Ensure auto-answer group in chat is set to disabled
custom_item_54.info:
Enable users to see and add contacts to 'auto-answer group' in the contact list on chat. Any call from members of this group will be automatically answered.

Rationale:
custom_item_54.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Auto-answer group in chat, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_55.description: 1.1.4.12 Ensure only show default email when sending email invites is set to enabled
custom_item_55.info:
Allow users to invite participants by email only by using the default email program selected on their computer.

Rationale:
custom_item_55.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Only show default email when sending email invites, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_56.description: 1.1.4.13 Ensure use HTML format email for Outlook plugin is set to enabled
custom_item_56.info:
Use HTML formatting instead of plain text for meeting invitations scheduled with the Outlook plugin.

Rationale:
custom_item_56.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Use HTML format email for Outlook plugin, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_57.description: 1.1.4.14 Ensure show a 'Join from your browser' link is set to enabled
custom_item_57.info:
Allow participants to bypass the Zoom application download process, and join a meeting directly from their browser. This is a workaround for participants who are unable to download, install, or run applications. Note that the meeting experience from the browser is limited.

Rationale:
custom_item_57.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Show a 'Join from your browser' link, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_58.description: 1.1.4.15 Ensure allow live streaming meetings is set to disabled
custom_item_58.info:
Allow live streaming meetings. Select Facebook Or Workplace by Facebook Or Youtube Or Custom Live Streaming Service.

Rationale:
custom_item_58.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Allow live streaming meetings, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_59.description: 1.1.4.17 Ensure request permission to unmute is set to enabled
custom_item_59.info:
Select this option in the scheduler to request permission to unmute meeting participants and webinar panelists. Permissions, once given, will apply in all meetings scheduled by the same person.

Rationale:
custom_item_59.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> In Meeting (Advanced) -> Request permission to unmute, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_60.description: 1.1.6.1.2 Ensure Send a copy to the person who scheduled the meeting/webinar for the host is set to enabled
custom_item_60.info:
Send a copy to the person who scheduled the meeting/webinar for the host. This can enable meeting scheduler to validate the recording for any confidential data prior sharing the video at large.

Rationale:
custom_item_60.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Email Notification -> Send a copy to the person who scheduled the meeting/webinar for the host, and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_61.description: 1.1.6.1.3 Ensure send a copy to the Alternative Hosts is set to enabled
custom_item_61.info:
Send a copy to the Alternative Hosts. This can enable alternate hosts to validate the recording for any confidential data prior sharing the video at large.

Rationale:
custom_item_61.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Email Notification -> Send a copy to the Alternative Hosts, and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_62.description: 1.1.6.4 Ensure when an alternative host is set or removed from a meeting is set to enabled
custom_item_62.info:
When an alternative host is set or removed from a meeting, Notify the alternative host who is set or removed. Helpful for any investigation.

Rationale:
custom_item_62.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Email Notification -> When an alternative host is set or removed from a meeting, and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_63.description: 1.1.7.1 Ensure blur snapshot on iOS task switcher is set to enabled
custom_item_63.info:
Enable this option to hide potentially sensitive information from the snapshot of the Zoom main window. This snapshot display as the preview screen in the iOS tasks switcher when multiple apps are open.

Rationale:
custom_item_63.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Admin Options -> Blur snapshot on iOS task switcher, and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_64.description: 1.1.7.2 Ensure display meetings scheduled for others is set to enabled
custom_item_64.info:
Display meetings scheduled for others. If disabled, users will only see their meetings even if they have schedule-for privilege for others.

Rationale:
custom_item_64.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Admin Options -> Display meetings scheduled for others, and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_65.description: 1.1.7.3 Ensure use content delivery network (CDN) is set to 'Default'
custom_item_65.info:
Allow connections to different CDNs for a better web browsing experience. All users under your organization will use the selected CDN to access static resources. By default, all users use Amazon CloudFront except users in China. Users in China use Wangsu (China) instead.

Rationale:
custom_item_65.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Admin Options -> Use content delivery network (CDN), and ensure it is set to enabled and 'Default' option is selected.

custom_item_66.description: 1.1.7.4 Ensure allow users to contact Zoom's support via chat is set to enabled
custom_item_66.info:
Show Zoom Help badge on the bottom right of the page

Rationale:
custom_item_66.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Meeting -> Admin Options -> Allow users to contact Zoom's Support via Chat, and ensure it is set to enabled.

custom_item_67.description: 1.2.1.1 Ensure local recording is set to enabled
custom_item_67.info:
Allow hosts and participants to record the meeting to a local file

Rationale:
custom_item_67.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Local recording, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_68.description: 1.2.2.2 Ensure record active speaker with shared screen is set to enabled
custom_item_68.info:
Record active speaker with shared screen

Rationale:
custom_item_68.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Cloud recording -> Record active speaker with shared screen, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_69.description: 1.2.2.3 Ensure record gallery view with shared screen is set to enabled
custom_item_69.info:
Record gallery view with shared screen

Rationale:
custom_item_69.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Cloud recording -> Record gallery view with shared screen, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_70.description: 1.2.2.4 Ensure record active speaker, gallery view and shared screen separately is set to enabled
custom_item_70.info:
Record active speaker, gallery view and shared screen separately. Useful to identify the participants, from various views at a later point in time for audit purpose.

Rationale:
custom_item_70.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Cloud recording -> Record active speaker, gallery view and shared screen separately, and ensure it is enabled and sub-options are checked.

custom_item_71.description: 1.2.2.5 Ensure record an audio only file is set to enabled
custom_item_71.info:
Record an audio only file. Useful in case of evidence for untampered audio file.

Rationale:
custom_item_71.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Cloud recording -> Record an audio only file, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_72.description: 1.2.2.6 Ensure save chat messages from the meeting / webinar is set to enabled
custom_item_72.info:
Save chat messages from the meeting / webinar. Useful for any investigations.

Rationale:
custom_item_72.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Cloud recording -> Save chat messages from the meeting / webinar, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_73.description: 1.2.3.1 Ensure add a timestamp to the recording is set to enabled
custom_item_73.info:
Add a timestamp to the recording by enabling this option.

Rationale:
custom_item_73.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Advanced cloud recording settings -> Add a timestamp to the recording, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_74.description: 1.2.3.3 Ensure record thumbnails when sharing is set to enabled
custom_item_74.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Advanced cloud recording settings -> Record thumbnails when sharing, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_75.description: 1.2.3.4 Ensure optimize the recording for 3rd party video editor is set to enabled
custom_item_75.info:
Optimize the recording for 3rd party video editor

Rationale:
custom_item_75.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Advanced cloud recording settings -> Optimize the recording for 3rd party video editor, and check if it is enabled.

custom_item_76.description: 1.2.3.5 Ensure save panelist chat to the recording is set to enabled
custom_item_76.info:
Save panelist chat to the recording helps as chat audit

Rationale:
custom_item_76.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Advanced cloud recording settings -> Save panelist chat to the recording, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_77.description: 1.2.4.1 Ensure automatic recording is set to enabled
custom_item_77.info:
Record meetings automatically as they start. Allows to capture evidence if any incidents that happen at start of meetings.

Rationale:
custom_item_77.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Automatic recording, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_78.description: 1.2.4.2 Ensure automatic recording is set to 'Record in the Cloud'
custom_item_78.info:
Record meetings automatically as they start. This option allows to capture evidence if any incidents that happen at start of meetings. Now select 'Record in the cloud' to preserve evidences.

Rationale:
custom_item_78.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Automatic recording -> Record in the cloud, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_79.description: 1.2.5.2 Ensure only the host can download cloud recordings is set to enabled
custom_item_79.info:
Enable 'Only the host can download cloud recordings' option to block others to download the cloud recordings.

Rationale:
custom_item_79.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Only the host can download cloud recordings, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_80.description: 1.2.6.4 Ensure passcode have at least 1 special character is set to enabled
custom_item_80.info:
Have at least 1 special character (!, @, #...)

Rationale:
custom_item_80.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Set minimum passcode strength requirements -> Have at least 1 special character (!, @, #...), and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_81.description: 1.2.6.5 Ensure allow numeric passcode is set to disabled
custom_item_81.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Set minimum passcode strength requirements -> Only allow numeric passcode, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_82.description: 1.2.8 Ensure prevent hosts from accessing their cloud recordings is set to enabled
custom_item_82.info:
By turning on this setting, the hosts cannot view their meeting cloud recordings. Only the admins who have recording management privilege can access them.

Rationale:
custom_item_82.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Prevent hosts from accessing their cloud recordings, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_83.description: 1.2.9 Ensure IP address access control is set to organization approved ranges
custom_item_83.info:
Allow cloud recording access only from specific IP address ranges. This option can enable certain IP address range within the organization, to allow download of recording. Once enabled, provide the IP ranges.

Rationale:
custom_item_83.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> IP Address Access Control, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_84.description: 1.2.10 Ensure require passcode to access shared cloud recordings is set to enabled
custom_item_84.info:
Passcode protection will be enforced for shared cloud recordings. A random passcode will be generated which can be modified by the users. This setting is applicable for newly generated recordings only.

Rationale:
custom_item_84.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Require passcode to access shared cloud recordings, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_85.description: 1.2.11 Ensure the host can delete cloud recordings is set to disabled
custom_item_85.info:
Allow the host to delete the recordings. If this option is disabled, the recordings cannot be deleted by the host and only admin can delete them.

Rationale:
custom_item_85.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> The host can delete cloud recordings, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_86.description: 1.2.12 Ensure allow recovery of deleted cloud recordings from trash is set to enabled
custom_item_86.info:
Deleted cloud recordings will be kept in trash for 30 days. These files will not count as part of the total storage allowance. Useful when downloaded recordings are accidentally deleted.

Rationale:
custom_item_86.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Account Settings -> Recording -> Allow recovery of deleted cloud recordings from Trash, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_87.description: 3.1.1.1.1 Ensure minimum password length is set to 9 characters or greater
custom_item_87.info:
Have a minimum password length of 9 characters or greater

Rationale:
custom_item_87.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Advanced -> Security -> Authentication -> Enhanced Password Requirement -> 9 characters or greater, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_88.description: 3.1.1.1.2 Ensure password have at least 1 special character is set to enabled
custom_item_88.info:
Have at least 1 special character (!, @, #...)

Rationale:
custom_item_88.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Advanced -> Security -> Authentication -> Enhanced Password Requirement -> Have at least 1 special character (!, @, #...), and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_89.description: 3.1.1.1.3 Ensure password cannot contain consecutive characters is set to enabled
custom_item_89.info:
Cannot contain consecutive characters (e.g. '11111', '12345', 'abcde', or 'qwert') and specify the length of consecutive characters to 4 or above.

Rationale:
custom_item_89.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Advanced -> Security -> Authentication -> Enhanced Password Requirement -> Cannot contain consecutive characters (e.g. '11111', '12345', 'abcde', or 'qwert'), and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_90.description: 3.1.1.1.4 Ensure use enhanced weak password detection is set to enabled
custom_item_90.info:
Use enhanced weak password detection.

Rationale:
custom_item_90.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Advanced -> Security -> Authentication -> Enhanced Password Requirement -> Use enhanced weak password detection, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_91.description: 3.1.1.3.2 Ensure allow importing of photos from the photo library on the user's device is set to disabled
custom_item_91.info:
Allow importing of photos from the photo library on the user's device.

Rationale:
custom_item_91.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Advanced -> Security -> Authentication -> Security -> Allow importing of photos from the photo library on the user's device, and ensure it is disabled.

custom_item_92.description: 3.1.1.3.3 Ensure hide billing information from administrators is set to enabled
custom_item_92.info:
Hide billing information from administrators.

Rationale:
custom_item_92.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Advanced -> Security -> Authentication -> Security -> Hide billing information from administrators, and ensure it is enabled.

custom_item_93.description: 3.2 Ensure integration is set to appropriate organizational needs
custom_item_93.info:
Integration, this page has option to enable/disable to various applications that can be integrated with zoom.

Rationale:

NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_93.solution: Go into the Zoom Admin Dashboard on the zoom website. Account Management -> Advanced -> Integration, and ensure only necessary options are enabled.
